main event: Pilots of a B-29 bomber spotted a bright light maneuvering rapidly over the Santa Ana area in California on January 9, 1953.
interesting points: The object was 4-5 times the size of the B-29 aircraft.
The object made rapid maneuvers, including a fast run and a sudden slowdown.
The object appeared to hold its speed for a split second before slanting upward and vanishing.
The pilots were familiar with the reflection characteristics of the B-29 and confirmed the object was not a ground reflection.
No experimental or other known aircraft were reported to be in the area at the time.
sighted object: A bright light, approximately 4-5 times the size of the B-29 aircraft
